page.title: 07Heights of Abraham - M.Bath
page.content: The{Heights of Abraham}are in Matlock Bath.They were named after a battle in Quebec fought by General Wolfe in 1759 They have been open as a tourist attraction since 1780.There is a{cable {car}linking the Heights to the valley bottom which was opened on 21.4.84.The rise is about 170m and the cable is 568m long.This cable car is unique to the U.K.Many safety precautions are taken and regular checks are made.You can see about 20 miles from the Heights and these views have led to Matlock Bath being called Little Switzerland.There are many tourist facilities including the Victoria Tower,Masson and Nester's mines,a tree top centre,gift shop,coffee shop,rest- aurant,picnic and play area and wood- land walks.They employ 30 people in the summer and 10 in winter.
